name: Utah Navajo Health System (UNHS)
address: Multiple locations across the Utah Strip of the Navajo Nation. For specific clinic addresses, please refer to their website
description: UNHS provides comprehensive healthcare, including mental health services, tailored to the unique needs and traditions of the Navajo community. They offer individual and group therapy, family counseling, traditional healing ceremonies, and crisis intervention
services: Alaska-Native-owned Trauma therapy in Utah consultation

name: Urban Indian Center of Salt Lake Behavioral Health Services
address: 120 W. 300 S., Salt Lake City, UT 84101
description: This center offers behavioral health services that blend evidence-based treatments with Indigenous ways of knowing, honoring Native American cultural traditions. They provide mental health counseling, substance use disorder treatment, and domestic violence survivor counseling
services: Alaska-Native-owned Trauma therapy in Utah consultation

name: NATIVation Counseling
address: Offers in-person and virtual therapy in Utah. Specific office locations can be found on their website
description: NATIVation Counseling provides holistic, trauma-informed therapy rooted in Indigenous healing. Founded by an Indigenous healer, their practice blends modern trauma therapy with sacred ceremonies, including EMDR and somatic work. They serve Native and non-Native individuals, couples, and families
services: Alaska-Native-owned Trauma therapy in Utah consultation
